author: Monty
title: The Saga is Complete.
review: In my opinion this is the best-looking TIE of the lot and well worth waiting for. I had previously made one from spares using TIE parts left over from set 10131 the TIE Collection and when I compared it to the set they were amazingly similar. I remember when I reviewed that set, I suggested one of the 2 normal TIEs should be replaced with an interceptor – perhaps now they will reissue a revised TIE Collection set that includes the Interceptor. It follows the normal TIE method of construction, the cockpit is identical to Vader’s TIE, but it has to be said it seems sturdier than the norm. I suspect if there were quality control problems with bricks in the new colours when they first came out, these have now been ironed out and the fit is snugger – not to say you can’t still get the wings to wobble if you really try. Wings contain some nice detail on the centre panels. The cockpit also seems less prone to bursting in your hands if you handle it and open the front to access the pilot. Price was OK 18 GBP - 15 would have been nicer. Again I got what I expected so I’ll give it a maximum score – especially for the improved fit.

author: p0dracer
title: Amazing set!
review: This set really blew my expectations. The size is perfect. The design is great and accurate. It feels solid in the hands. The way the 4 slanted wing panels snap down is amazing. I think its my favourite lego set so far.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great! but.....
review:
when i first got this set, i thought it was great! i built it in 2mins and i really liked it. the minifig was great, and it looked very good. its not rare to have a model that looks like the real thing, but this as an excellent deseign!

the one problem i had was that this set rolls on its face when i try to stand it up, maybe a deseign fault? its more of a playing model than one whom lives on a shelf! it costs more than a normal tie, but wellworth the extra money. if you are a tie fan then get this model now to add to your collection.

author: Jedd_the_Jedi
title: Tried and tested Formula that works!
review: This set adopts the tried and tested TIE craft formula, with similar wing arrangement and cockpit design, and is proof that it truly succeeds! Fans such as myself have been hankering long and hard for a minifig-scale incarnation of this speedy spacecraft, and are finally pacified. Detail is heaped onto the basic frame, with a reasonable structural integrity and only slight affliction of "wobbly wings". TIE afficianados should not miss out!

author: david001
title: Flawless model
review:
Ah: the good old TIE Interceptor. The last of the original TIE designs to appear in the movies, the Interceptor is a superb fighter craft, boasting four lasers instead of two.

The model is superb as well: there's no mistaking those twin prong wings or the top and bottom 'fold'.  While the wings do suffer from the slight wobbliness that plagues all the other Lego TIE family, the ball cockpit is a superb reproduction of the original: it's great how Lego managed to pull that off out of mainly essentially square bricks!

author: brickbuster2409
title: the last ship to complete the tie fighter series
review: i already had all the imperial ships except for the interceptor and when it came out i was excited.  i got this ship half-price for 10 bucks at wal mart.  the is still the same but the wings are awesome.  i like the unique design on the wings b/c they give the fighter more of an exciting shape.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great set!
review:
This is a great set which has great playability if you have any more imperial ships.

Pros:
Detail
Playability

Cons:
Gets boring because of the way that TIE ships are created.

Not much to say but its a great set and i reccommend it to all.

author: Gert_Jan
title: Best of the familie
review: I think this set is the best of the TIE familie. It has great looking wings and more weapons. The pilot looks great and it has a black head instead of a brown one. But I think this TIE is a bit to blue. Not that I don't like the blue colour but this is a bit to mutch. But how cares? It is stil the best looking TIE there is so if you like TIE fighters then I sugest in buying one.

author: Darth_Shockwave
title: The Tie's finally complete
review:
The Tie Interceptor, the update of the Tie Fighter and the cheaper design variation of Vader's Tie advance. The Interceptor makes it's one and only appearance in Return of the Jedi. Most notebly during the end core run, several Interceptors are chasing Lando and Wedge. This model is once again made in the Lego Tie colours of black, blue and grey, I know the actual fighters are black and dark, but I think the Lego colours suit it nicley. The attention to detail is very nice with the guns and targeting sensors looking quite like how they should. The cockpit is the same one thats used in the other Tie Fighter models, it's a mixture off the 2. Which is good as it gives the fighters a sence off familiarity. Funnily enough the base off the model is designed for a stand, the same one used in the first Tie fighter model. But Lego did not give us one, strange. Anyways onto the pro's and con's.

Pro's: - 
Use's same Tie cockpit
Fleet builder
Finally made after 7 years
Good attention to detail
Fits in well with othe Tie's class fighters

Con's: - 
The cockpit hatch can come of too easily
Does not come with display stand
Wobbley wings

Overall: - This is a nicely put together set, which is a very welcome addition to the Imperial fleet. Just why did it not come out earlier.

author: jellylikepie
title: Great Set!
review:
I got this set for 14.99 and it was really worth the money.

Pros:
Easy Build
Very Cheap
Great Minifig
Looks Awesome
Cockpit is nice and is easy to get the minifig in or out
Cons:
The wings rattle around when you move it.

This set is too good for the price. Try to get it off Ebay or somewhere because its much cheaper.

author: Legonater
title: The Emperore's Fleet attacks!
review: This is my first TIE, and it's awesome. I got my first TIE pilot, greeat playability once you get a rebal fighter, and it's very movie accurate, though you don't really see it all that much in the final battal...

author: Skodyna
title: More LEGO, less STAR WARS
review:
From the view of a LEGO fan this is a brilliant set- nice design, technology and so on... But there are some mistakes compared to the TIE Interceptor in STAR WARS films!
Real TIE I was smaller! Now, in LEGO design it´s wider than normal TIE. In films, the wings were closer to the cocpit. As well I don´t understand, why there that blue color is!
So in the end, one point down because of the size, one because of colours. But still, there was a lot of work done on this model by LEGO designers, so TIE I deserves to be bought.

author: Jonamaster
title: Good Set.
review:
Ok.. This set is great and everything but it has some flaws.. Heres the Pros, and cons.


Pros:
Good Minifigure
Great Details

Cons:

When You open the     pit, it breaks. (only the part that opens)




I think LEGO could have done better with this set.
So if you think you should get this set.. You should. But only with money left over.

author: reidak49
title: sweet!
review: well nice set it looks like a tie interceptor but you dont see the tie intercepter in the movies much the wings might be fragile this thing has has 6 laser canons and the tie pilot is cool but it looks like it is bigger than the tie fighter

author: tauntaunwampa
title: Nice Character to add to the Family
review:
This is the best TIE set of them all. The detail and scale is perfect and a good-old Tie pilot to top it off but the only thing bad about this set is the colours. With all the Ties (except for the USC Ties) the lines are blue but they are meant to be grey.

PROS
nice Scale
good Design
perfect Detail
TIE pilot
CONS
Colours 

This is a really good set and a perfect thing for the TIE family.

author: Caramel
title: Not great but good
review: This is a good set. You get a tie fighter pilot. The bad parts are, The wings are wobelly I keep thinking thell fall off, and the cockpit falls off easy, and the pilot does'nt have a gun.Over all good set.

author: Da_LegoBuilder
title: awesome!
review: This set is pretty good, and it looks like the one in the movies. It has very good detail. I like the tie fighter minifig the most,it looks cool! The only thing that might be better would be that they should have two, like an escort for an imperial landing craft! The color scheme could have been better, and it could have been in porportion to the minifig.

author: Leggodt94
title: Best tie yet!
review: I know I've complained about the tie's "boringness" in its construction, but with this set I can't complain! This set feartures a couple of things that other ties don't mainly the sleekness in design. This model is scarcely seen in Return of the Jedi, but I'm glad that TLC was able to pic it up. This set also includes, of course, a classic tie pilot minifigure. One other great thing about this set is that it is also inexpensive so you can get lots of 'em. Yep, another great addition to the tie family, an addition that will make your tie collection complete!

author: andy94
title: tie interceptor
review:
This is a great set for who wants build an imperial fleet.

Pros
-big
-good pieces
-tie pilot

Cons
-pilot hasn't a blaster
-wings are instable

Finally tihs is a good addition for your TIE collection.

author: sudorum
title: Apparently Lego is Color Blind
review: I've had this set for years, it was just so annoying I never got around to rating it. The set comes with one useful minifig. As for the ship itself, it is the definition of inaccurate. No  Star Wars ship in the history of the series has ever been BLUE! Even if Lego committed this atrocity just to make the ship appear "pretty," it was certainly a very poor attempt. Hopefully, Lego will come out with an accurate version some day.

author: DarthVader_
title: Awesome set!
review: This set is awesome!  The trooper is really cool!  I like how you can take off the black head and put on a real Lego head!  The set is really fun and it goes great with the Y-Wing!  One of my FAVORITE Lego Sets!

author: mvila09
title: Awesome TIE
review: This set is cool because it is the only TIE around 2006.pros TIE pilot cool cock pit opens cool empire signal 4 lasers 212 pieces is good to mix with TIE collection.ahh i just remember the old TIE the memories

author: thenaterater
title: the tie fighter collection is complete!
review: i love this set, it is awesome to put on display, or to play with.  i think that the opening mechanism is a bit awkward, and sometimes breaks, but is very clever, i wish that they had put in a stand to set it on, and wish they had done that for all of the ties, it is super cool though, and i love the wings!

author: clonewars29
title: good value
review: this set was a very fun build for 20 bucks. the design and look is great but not many features or moving parts. over time the cockpit hinge will wear down and not work as well, but it still gets a 5 in my book just for coolness! a great addition to the TIE family!

author: VideoGameLord613
title: I feel better about this set
review:

author: Yoda____
title: perfect price
review: I disagree with he people who say that this set as wobbly wings it doesn't bother me and I think this is the most imaginative tie fighter and also has a great figure. Leave this set alone, it's good, It's fun deal with it disbelivers, fun is what lego is all about so in theory this is a good set and it ir in real life.

author: southpaw
title: Best TIE fighter out there!
review: In a galaxy far, far away flies this awsome lego set. This set is a must-get for anyone who likes Star Wars Lego sets! Also, this seems the most versitile TIE fighter design. I really enjoy the sleek wing panels, easy access cockpit, and best of all, no stickers!

author: Kalhiki
title: a vicouse-looking fighter.
review:
When you look at this thing the first thing you notice are the threatening wings. The four prongs add an evil edge to the overall fighter. It also has, on each wing, a cannon. The wings probably have the most detail including an Empire symbol and blue bars against then black wings. Then there are the two bars on each side connecting the wings to the body. These aren't the best and are ugly in my opinion. Luckily those awsome wings make up for it. The body is okay. The cockpit has the octaganal shape design on it which is a nice touch. On the cockpit are also 2 guns. I guess they're guns, they could be headlights. And as all tie fighters have, This one has the topshell piece with those electronic designs.
That's really all. Overall... ... That word is overused in my reviews... In conclusion,  a brilliant set. This is probably my favorite Tie out of all of them. So I highly recommend getting this model.

author: Mstranzl3
title: Fragile !
review:
This is a set I got for my birthday a while back and it looks pretty cool (but is very fragile).Now lets check out the good and the bad.

  The Good: It looks cool,is a good use of pieces and has no stickers.

  The Bad: It is very fragile,has barely any playability (by itself), and has a very basic minifig.






      It is an okay set but the lack of playability and he fact that the wings fall off easily make it a display item.
      I rate 3 out of 5 stars and if have another ship to battle it buy it but if you dont' have another ship don't buy 
      it.

author: EtudeTheBadger
title: 'TIE Interceptor here!' - Pilot, Empire At War (with husky American drawl)
review:
Another year, another TIE. This time around, we've got the flash-speed Interceptor model, with extra armament.
 

Though not really anything groundbreaking, the Interceptor is a worthy addition to the Imperial Fleet, in the way that it is aerodynamic and swooshable to a great degree. It comes with a standard TIE pilot and control panel, with better-fitted hatch plate (uses a 2x4 plate rather than a 2x1 part) and reinforced rear (uses a niche part at the back of the cockpit). It's a great design and a nice purchase- just don't expect anything new in the way of parts or experience if you already have any TIE models. For a newbie, it's a good buy.

  • Pros:
  • Nice implementations
     
  • Another pilot
  • Good representation of fighter
  • Cons:
  • Nothing new at all

TIE Interceptor out.

author: The_Dumb_One
title: All hands, man your battle stations!
review:
This is a great set, sturdy, slick, easy to play with, and fun to destroy in battle. Certain problems occur with the wings from time to time, as they are the one spot that are not solidly attached, but not enough to cause problems. The build is a bit redundent seeing as ist the same thing on both sides, but that is understandable.

I love destroying this vessel, so it's a good thing that the ship is mainly comprised of 7 chunks that come of without difficulty, but not when you don't wan't them to.

I also enjoy the original Imperial pilot. I bought the TIE Defender and I'm not too keen on the wierd helmet.

The parts are great because you can use them for anything you want. The ship can easily be transformed into a normal TIE fighter or a TIE advanced and I added extra weaponry to mine with much enthusiasm.

All in all, it's a great ship to add to a budding fleet and a must-have for any Star Wars collector.

author: Brickman_oo_
title: Great set!
review: The tie interceptor is a very cool set. It has an opening cockpit with controls, a very cool minifigure, four blasters on each wing, and on the back there is a blue piece which is the thrusters. Great addition to any sith starfighter from episodes 4-6.

author: zako11
title: Take Down The Rebelion With This
review:
This set is really good it comes with one pilot which if you bought it you could buy him the modified helmet on the customer service at lego.com.Also its wings can fold out so it maybe easier to balance if you place it on the ground.it also has 4 guns 1 on each wing so you can "pretend" its firing if you are 1 of these people who play with the sets (like me).  Its price back in the day was quite good i had to pay £19.99 for it and that was still worth it (because its usually £17.99).

Its also a good set if you want to add it to your imperial fleet (for collectors purposes)versing your rebel fleet.This set is completely worth getting if you have a rebel ship to go with it,i would give this set a 9/10 because it doesnt have any features but is still fun to play with. So if you see this set cheap on ebay get it .

author: PaulTR
title: The Coolest TIE You Can Get!
review:
This set is a great set for any true Star Wars fan. When released in 2006, I didn't take much notice of it. But my little brother's birthday was coming up, so I popped on over to a Walmart, and picked one up. Since then, I've played with it more than he has!

 What I really like about this set is its look: it has an overall dagger-like shape that adds a touch of menace about it. I think it has to be one of the meanest looking starfighters in Star Wars. The four wing-tip cannons, combined with the chin blasters, make it look much more sinister than, say, a Y-wing. I don't even think the grotesque TIE Defender set can match its simple, yet beastly, look. It is also pretty sturdy, and its fun to 'swish' around your room with an X-wing or A-wing set, if you like to do that sort of thing (which I do ;) Also, it has 212 pieces, so $20 is an even price for it, though the pieces aren't all that exciting. 

However, like all TIE sets, it was a bit of a repetitive build, and there's not a whole lot of "action" features. You can load the Imperial pilot in, move his little control panel, and that's abou it. So if action features, like missile launchers or ejection seats, are your thing, I wouldn't recommend this set. And it only comes with one minifig, although I don't know how they could include another one. Also, some people might not like the blue coloring, it being in contrast to the gray and black of Darth Vader's TIE and the new Defender. However, I don't mind it at all, as I think it gives the set a sort of 'classic' LEGO Star Wars feel to it; and if you don't like the blue tiles, you could always replace them with some gray tiles. On to the pros and cons!

 

  • Pros:
  • Menacing look!
  • Decent piece to price ratio.
  • Cool old-school Imperial pilot minifigure.
  • Very sturdy.
  • Great opponent for the A-wing set.
  • Waaaay beastlier than your average TIE fighter!
  • Cons:
  • Boring build :(
  • Not many action features.
  • Blue color may draw a critical eye or two.
  • No extra minifgs.

Overall, I give this set a 4 out of 5. Personally, I think this is the best TIE set LEGO has released to date. It looks great, has awesome swooshibility, and can take out any "Rebel scum" in your collection! After one look at those dagger wings, you'll fall in love with Imperial engineering all over again! 

  •

author: Zatth
title: Once again, why is it blue?
review:
This is my first Star Wars set that had a minifigure. (Previously, I had only had the early MINI collection) So naturally, it holds an important spot in my collection. The value for money is hard to determine, because it was a gift, but I see that it was around 20.00 USD, which I think is a little overpriced. As many before me have stated, the panels should be Grey and not Blue. But don't let that deter you, the blue adds interest. The build was a short and pleasant experience, especially the cockpit. There is a lot of room in that cockpit, so I was able to give my TIE Pilot minifigure a blaster and radio, for personality. (I'm still proud of my old-mold minifigure, as oppose to the new, albeit more realistic helmet mold.) The finished model feels a little flimsy around the wings, and so it is. You ought to be a little careful when swooshing. Speaking of swooshing, by the way, this model is really swoosh-able. It's very playable, and makes for great battles if you have an Alliance starfighter.

Pros

  • Fun, short build
  • Great old minifigure (now rare and unique!)
  • Looks powerful and impressive, especially if you have more than one
  • Nice selection of pieces for MOC's, especially plates. Lots of plates!

Cons

  • Why blue panels instead of Grey??
  • A little flimsy, won't stand up to much punishment

 This piece is a great addition to any Lego Star Wars collection. You can't go wrong getting this set!

author: Chills
title: Old school LEGO TIE set, still nice to have in the collection
review:
This set was another eBay acquisition when I emerged from my Dark Ages and got caught up on all the sets I missed out on buying when they came out in the stores. Being a big fan of all things Imperial (especially the TIEs) I had to have this set. I know many people aren't fans of the old school blue/black TIEs, but this one is a decent set and a good addition to the collection.

Pros

  • Pro 1: The set is true to its ROTJ movie appearances. LEGO did a good job designing this set. It also has more detail than other TIE sets of this era, especially in the wings/solar panels.
  • Pro 2: It is a pretty straight-forward and quick build, the wings taking the most time. To cut down on the repetitive feeling I built them at the same time. You get some good black plates and some nice blue tiles for your collection.
  • Pro 3: Good playability. Not great, but pretty good. This set is simple, not much to it, so it has a cockpit that opens/closes and wings that pop off easily.

Cons

  • Con 1: As with all TIEs of this generation LEGO didn't put much into it. The set is basic, not much there. I have the new Vader's TIE version and it has a lot more detail. I hope LEGO re-releases the TIE Interceptor with more detail and more playability.
  • Con 2: Only one minifigure. As I've mentioned in other reviews I'm getting spoiled with the new sets, they all have 3+ minifigures. This one only has one, and the helmet is the stormtrooper one painted black. That's now considered old-school LEGO, but I'd rather have a real TIE helmet.
  • Con 3: As with all TIE sets of this generation is it flimsy. The wings come off very easily and the set is not very stable. This is something that has been fixed on more recent TIE sets.
I gave this set a pretty average rating because it's not a bad set, but it isn't a great set. If you are a TIE collector like me then this is a must-have. I see a lot of reviews dinging LEGO for the blue on the TIEs, but I have to say I like it. It makes the ship less-sinister looking; but I will say I'm looking forward to a TIE Interceptor that's all grey and black and more solid.

author: LegoMadRo7
title: Realistic
review:
This model is a lot like the vehicle in StarWars. It is a good model and it is

really, really cool

Box/Instructions

The completed model

looks awesome

author: zipsforbananas
title: If only this weren't blue it'd be a great basic set!
review:
Star Wars sets don't get much more basic than this, but the result is very pleasing. It's an iconic ship, and is very well presented.

Pros

  • Simple, sturdy build.
  • Good presence when built.
  • Good scale; not too small, not too big.

Cons

  • It really should be grey! About 60 pieces to replace to make it look good!
  • A little wing wobble given the design, no big gripe though.


It isn't much effort to switch the blue for grey, but costs quite a bit compared to buying the set. If Lego had done it in grey to begin with I'd say it was perfect for what it is.
